column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A CENTURION OF THE THIRTIETH
#Text=Cities and Thrones and Powers Stand in Time 's eye , Almost as long as flowers , Which daily die .
#Text=But , as new buds put forth To glad new men , Out of the spent and unconsidered Earth The Cities rise again .
#Text=This season 's Daffodil , She never hears What change , what chance , what chill , Cut down last year 's : But with bold countenance , And knowledge small , Esteems her seven days ' continuance
#Text=To be perpetual .

#Text=So Time that is o'er-kind To all that be , Ordains us e'en as blind , As bold as she : That in our very death , And burial sure , Shadow to shadow , well persuaded , saith , ' See how our works endure ! '
#Text=Dan had come to grief over his Latin , and was kept in ; so Una went alone to Far Wood .
#Text=Dan 's big catapult and the lead bullets that Hobden had made for him were hidden in an old hollow beech-stub on the west of the wood .
#Text=They had named the place out of the verse in Lays of Ancient Rome :
#Text=From lordly Volaterrae , Where scowls the far-famed hold Piled by the hands of giants For Godlike Kings of old .
#Text=They were the ' Godlike Kings ' , and when old Hobden piled some comfortable brushwood between the big wooden knees of Volaterrae , they called him ' Hands of Giants ' .

#Text=Una slipped through their private gap in the fence , and sat still awhile , scowling as scowlily and lordlily as she knew how ; for Volaterrae is an important watch-tower that juts out of Far Wood just as Far Wood juts out of the hillside .
#Text=Pook 's Hill lay below her and all the turns of the brook as it wanders out of the Willingford Woods , between hop-gardens , to old Hobden 's cottage at the Forge .
#Text=The sou'-west wind ( there is always a wind by Volaterrae ) blew from the bare ridge where Cherry Clack Windmill stands .
#Text=Now wind prowling through woods sounds like exciting things going to happen , and that is why on blowy days you stand up in Volaterrae and shout bits of the Lays to suit its noises .
#Text=Una took Dan 's catapult from its secret place , and made ready to meet Lars Porsena 's army stealing through the wind-whitened aspens by the brook .
#Text=A gust boomed up the valley , and Una chanted sorrowfully :
#Text=' Verbenna down to Ostia Hath wasted all the plain : Astur hath stormed Janiculum , And the stout guards are slain . '
#Text=But the wind , not charging fair to the wood , started aside and shook a single oak in Gleason 's pasture .
#Text=Here it made itself all small and crouched among the grasses , waving the tips of them as a cat waves the tip of her tail before she springs .
#Text=' Now welcome -- welcome , Sextus , ' sang Una , loading the catapult -- '
#Text=Now welcome to thy home !
#Text=Why dost thou stay , and turn away ?
#Text=Here lies the road to Rome .
#Text='
#Text=She fired into the face of the lull , to wake up the cowardly wind , and heard a grunt from behind a thorn in the pasture .
#Text=' Oh , my Winkie ! ' she said aloud , and that was something she had picked up from Dan . ' I b'lieve I 've tickled up a Gleason cow . '
#Text=' You little painted beast ! ' a voice cried .
#Text='
#Text=I 'll teach you to sling your masters ! '
#Text=She looked down most cautiously , and saw a young man covered with hoopy bronze armour all glowing among the late broom .
#Text=But what Una admired beyond all was his great bronze helmet with a red horse-tail that flicked in the wind .
#Text=She could hear the long hairs rasp on his shimmery shoulder-plates .
#Text=' What does the Faun mean , ' he said , half aloud to himself , ' by telling me that the Painted People have changed ? '
#Text=He caught sight of Una 's yellow head .
#Text='
#Text=Have you seen a painted lead-slinger ? ' he called .
#Text=' No-o , ' said Una . '
#Text=But if you 've seen a bullet -- '
#Text=' Seen ? ' cried the man . '
#Text=It passed within a hair's -- breadth of my ear . '
#Text=' Well , that was me .
#Text=I 'm most awfully sorry . '
#Text='
#Text=Did n't the Faun tell you I was coming ? '
#Text=He smiled .
#Text='
#Text=Not if you mean Puck .
#Text=I thought you were a Gleason cow .
#Text=I -- I did n't know you were a -- a -- What are you ? '
#Text=He laughed outright , showing a set of splendid teeth .
#Text=His face and eyes were dark , and his eyebrows met above his big nose in one bushy black bar .
#Text=' They call me Parnesius .
#Text=I have been a Centurion of the Seventh Cohort of the Thirtieth Legion -- the Ulpia Victrix .
#Text=Did you sling that bullet ? '
#Text=' I did .
#Text=I was using Dan 's catapult , ' said Una .
#Text=' Catapults ! ' said he . ' I ought to know something about them .
#Text=Show me ! '
#Text=He leaped the rough fence with a rattle of spear , shield , and armour , and hoisted himself into Volaterrae as quickly as a shadow .
#Text=' A sling on a forked stick .
#Text=I understand ! ' he cried , and pulled at the elastic . '
#Text=But what wonderful beast yields this stretching leather ? '
#Text='
#Text=It 's laccy -- elastic .
#Text=You put the bullet into that loop , and then you pull hard .
#Text='
#Text=The man pulled , and hit himself square on his thumbnail .
#Text='
#Text=Each to his own weapon , ' he said gravely , handing it back . '
#Text=I am better with the bigger machine , little maiden .
#Text=But it 's a pretty toy .
#Text=A wolf would laugh at it .
#Text=Are n't you afraid of wolves ? '
#Text='
#Text=There are n't any , ' said Una .
#Text='
#Text=Never believe it !
#Text=A wolf 's like a Winged Hat .
#Text=He comes when he is n't expected .
#Text=Do n't they hunt wolves here ? '
